        }
      </style>


      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/95.0.4628.3 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/95.0.4628.3 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>#TestOn<span class="line"><!---->#TestOn<!----></span><br>Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64<span class="line"><!---->Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64<!----></span><br>git status<span class="line"><!---->git status<!----></span><br>HEAD detached from 77ffd97a139<span class="line"><!---->HEAD detached from 77ffd97a139<!----></span><br><br>#Reproduce<span class="line"><!---->#Reproduce<!----></span><br>This issue is not stable to reproduce, but it is easy to find through a code audit, so I did not provide a POC but provided an analysis<span class="line"><!---->This issue is not stable to reproduce, but it is easy to find through a code audit, so I did not provide a POC but provided an analysis<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash<!----></span><br>gpu process<span class="line"><!---->gpu process<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 95.0.4628.3  Channel: n/a<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 95.0.4628.3  Channel: n/a<!----></span><br>OS Version: 10.0<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: 10.0<!----></span><br><br>#Analysis<span class="line"><!---->#Analysis<!----></span><br>CommandBufferProxyImpl is member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj,This issue occurs in a special situation, when CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect is called, it will cause ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj to be released, resulting in UAF.<span class="line"><!---->CommandBufferProxyImpl is member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj,This issue occurs in a special situation, when CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect is called, it will cause ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj to be released, resulting in UAF.<!----></span><br><br>1. CommandBufferProxyImpl obj created when ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread() call and save as a unique_ptr member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer<span class="line"><!---->1. CommandBufferProxyImpl obj created when ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread() call and save as a unique_ptr member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer<!----></span><br>2. CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize was call form ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread(),in CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize it will set CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect as set_disconnect_handler callback<span class="line"><!---->2. CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize was call form ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread(),in CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize it will set CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect as set_disconnect_handler callback<!----></span><br>3. When set_disconnect_handler called OnDisconnect call OnGpuAsyncMessageError,which Will eventually call ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() because[4]<span class="line"><!---->3. When set_disconnect_handler called OnDisconnect call OnGpuAsyncMessageError,which Will eventually call ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() because[4]<!----></span><br>4. ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() will take ref of this[5],and relese this out of scope.<span class="line"><!---->4. ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() will take ref of this[5],and relese this out of scope.<!----></span><br>5. Then the function returns to CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect and operates on lock_&last_state_lock_, because ContextProviderCommandBuffer released cause CommandBufferProxyImpl released too, resulting in UAF. <span class="line"><!---->5. Then the function returns to CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect and operates on lock_&amp;last_state_lock_, because ContextProviderCommandBuffer released cause CommandBufferProxyImpl released too, resulting in UAF. <!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>//<span class="line"><!---->//<!----></span><br>services/viz/public/cpp/gpu/context_provider_command_buffer.cc：141<span class="line"><!---->services/viz/public/cpp/gpu/context_provider_command_buffer.cc：141<!----></span><br>gpu::ContextResult ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread() {<span         by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1250655#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Sep 17, 2021, 6:49 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1250655#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Sep 17, 2021, 6:49 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          sunn...@chromium.org kylec...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          sunn...@chromium.org kylec...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Looks valid, and also looks like this bug may have existed for quite a while.<span class="line"><!---->Looks valid, and also looks like this bug may have existed for quite a while.<!----></span><br><br>AFAICT ContextProviderCommandBuffer has ~always synchronously invoked OnContextLost on its observers in response to context loss, and CommandBufferProxyImpl has never been safe to delete within GpuControlClient::OnGpuControlLostContext due to CBPI's lock management around that invocation.<span class="line"><!---->AFAICT ContextProviderCommandBuffer has ~always synchronously invoked OnContextLost on its observers in response to context loss, and CommandBufferProxyImpl has never been safe to delete within GpuControlClient::OnGpuControlLostContext due to CBPI's lock management around that invocation.<!----></span><br><br>So as long as it's been possible for an observer's OnContextLost to result in CPCB deletion, this bug has been possible. I see a local stack ref was added some time later to prevent the CPCB from being destroyed within OnLostContext itself, but of course it (and its CBPI) can still then be destroyed upon OnLostContext return in that case.<span class="line"><!---->So as long as it's been possible for an observer's OnContextLost to result in CPCB deletion, this bug has been possible. I see a local stack ref was added some time later to prevent the CPCB from being destroyed within OnLostContext itself, but of course it (and its CBPI) can still then be destroyed upon OnLostContext return in that case.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        ContextProviderCommandBuffer owns a pretty complicated hierarchy of classes and context loss handling code is messy. I'm sure the context loss code could be reworked to be a bit more straight forward and hopefully avoid this UAF but..<span class="line"><!---->ContextProviderCommandBuffer owns a pretty complicated hierarchy of classes and context loss handling code is messy. I'm sure the context loss code could be reworked to be a bit more straight forward and hopefully avoid this UAF but..<!----></span><br><br>I wonder if ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() could just post a task to delete the scoped_ref<ContextProviderCommandBuffer> it holds to ensure it's impossible to destroy the ContextProviderCommandBuffer object in the same call stack as the context loss event?<span class="line"><!---->I wonder if ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() could just post a task to delete the scoped_ref&lt;ContextProviderCommandBuffer&gt; it holds to ensure it's impossible to destroy the ContextProviderCommandBuffer object in the same call stack as the context loss event?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/95.0.4628.3 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/95.0.4628.3 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>#TestOn<span class="line"><!---->#TestOn<!----></span><br>Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64<span class="line"><!---->Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64<!----></span><br>git status<span class="line"><!---->git status<!----></span><br>HEAD detached from 77ffd97a139<span class="line"><!---->HEAD detached from 77ffd97a139<!----></span><br><br>#Reproduce<span class="line"><!---->#Reproduce<!----></span><br>This issue is not stable to reproduce, but it is easy to find through a code audit, so I did not provide a POC but provided an analysis<span class="line"><!---->This issue is not stable to reproduce, but it is easy to find through a code audit, so I did not provide a POC but provided an analysis<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash<!----></span><br>gpu process<span class="line"><!---->gpu process<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 95.0.4628.3  Channel: n/a<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 95.0.4628.3  Channel: n/a<!----></span><br>OS Version: 10.0<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: 10.0<!----></span><br><br>#Analysis<span class="line"><!---->#Analysis<!----></span><br>CommandBufferProxyImpl is member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj,This issue occurs in a special situation, when CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect is called, it will cause ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj to be released, resulting in UAF.<span class="line"><!---->CommandBufferProxyImpl is member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj,This issue occurs in a special situation, when CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect is called, it will cause ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj to be released, resulting in UAF.<!----></span><br><br>1. CommandBufferProxyImpl obj created when ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread() call and save as a unique_ptr member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer<span class="line"><!---->1. CommandBufferProxyImpl obj created when ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread() call and save as a unique_ptr member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer<!----></span><br>2. CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize was call form ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread(),in CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize it will set CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect as set_disconnect_handler callback<span class="line"><!---->2. CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize was call form ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread(),in CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize it will set CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect as set_disconnect_handler callback<!----></span><br>3. When set_disconnect_handler called OnDisconnect call OnGpuAsyncMessageError,which Will eventually call ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() because[4]<span class="line"><!---->3. When set_disconnect_handler called OnDisconnect call OnGpuAsyncMessageError,which Will eventually call ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() because[4]<!----></span><br>4. ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() will take ref of this[5],and relese this out of scope.<span class="line"><!---->4. ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() will take ref of this[5],and relese this out of scope.<!----></span><br>5. Then the function returns to CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect and operates on lock_&last_state_lock_, because ContextProviderCommandBuffer released cause CommandBufferProxyImpl released too, resulting in UAF. <span class="line"><!---->5. Then the function returns to CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect and operates on lock_&amp;last_state_lock_, because ContextProviderCommandBuffer released cause CommandBufferProxyImpl released too, resulting in UAF. <!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>//<span class="line"><!---->//<!----></span><br>services/viz/public/cpp/gpu/context_provider_command_buffer.cc：141<span class="line"><!---->services/viz/public/cpp/gpu/context_provider_command_buffer.cc：141<!----></span><br>gpu::ContextResult ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread() {<span class="line"><!---->gpu::ContextResult ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread() {<!----></span><br>  // This is called on the thread the context will be used.<span class="line"><!---->  // This is called on the thread the context will be used.<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(context_thread_checker_.CalledOnValidThread());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(context_thread_checker_.CalledOnValidThread());<!----></span><br><br><<<-CUT->>><span class="line"><!---->&lt;&lt;&lt;-CUT-&gt;&gt;&gt;<!----></span><br>  // This command buffer is a client-side proxy to the command buffer in the<span class="line"><!---->  // This command buffer is a client-side proxy to the command buffer in the<!----></span><br>  // GPU process.<span class="line"><!---->  // GPU process.<!----></span><br>  command_buffer_ = std::make_unique<gpu::CommandBufferProxyImpl>(			<<[1]<span class="line"><!---->  command_buffer_ = std::make_unique&lt;gpu::CommandBufferProxyImpl&gt;(			&lt;&lt;[1]<!----></span><br>      channel_, gpu_memory_buffer_manager_, stream_id_, task_runner);<span class="line"><!---->      channel_, gpu_memory_buffer_manager_, stream_id_, task_runner);<!----></span><br>  bind_result_ = command_buffer_->Initialize(<span class="line"><!---->  bind_result_ = command_buffer_-&gt;Initialize(<!----></span><br>      surface_handle_, /*shared_command_buffer=*/nullptr, stream_priority_,<span class="line"><!---->      surface_handle_, /*shared_command_buffer=*/nullptr, stream_priority_,<!----></span><br>      attributes_, active_url_);<span class="line"><!---->      attributes_, active_url_);<!----></span><br><br>//<span class="line"><!---->//<!----></span><br>gpu/ipc/client/command_buffer_proxy_impl.cc:136  <span class="line"><!---->gpu/ipc/client/command_buffer_proxy_impl.cc:136  <!----></span><br>ContextResult CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize(<span class="line"><!---->ContextResult CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize(<!----></span><br>    gpu::SurfaceHandle surface_handle,<span class="line"><!---->         by

          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          sunn...@chromium.org kylec...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          sunn...@chromium.org kylec...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Looks valid, and also looks like this bug may have existed for quite a while.<span class="line"><!---->Looks valid, and also looks like this bug may have existed for quite a while.<!----></span><br><br>AFAICT ContextProviderCommandBuffer has ~always synchronously invoked OnContextLost on its observers in response to context loss, and CommandBufferProxyImpl has never been safe to delete within GpuControlClient::OnGpuControlLostContext due to CBPI's lock management around that invocation.<span class="line"><!---->AFAICT ContextProviderCommandBuffer has ~always synchronously invoked OnContextLost on its observers in response to context loss, and CommandBufferProxyImpl has never been safe to delete within GpuControlClient::OnGpuControlLostContext due to CBPI's lock management around that invocation.<!----></span><br><br>So as long as it's been possible for an observer's OnContextLost to result in CPCB deletion, this bug has been possible. I see a local stack ref was added some time later to prevent the CPCB from being destroyed within OnLostContext itself, but of course it (and its CBPI) can still then be destroyed upon OnLostContext return in that case.<span class="line"><!---->So as long as it's been possible for an observer's OnContextLost to result in CPCB deletion, this bug has been possible. I see a local stack ref was added some time later to prevent the CPCB from being destroyed within OnLostContext itself, but of course it (and its CBPI) can still then be destroyed upon OnLostContext return in that case.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        ContextProviderCommandBuffer owns a pretty complicated hierarchy of classes and context loss handling code is messy. I'm sure the context loss code could be reworked to be a bit more straight forward and hopefully avoid this UAF but..<span class="line"><!---->ContextProviderCommandBuffer owns a pretty complicated hierarchy of classes and context loss handling code is messy. I'm sure the context loss code could be reworked to be a bit more straight forward and hopefully avoid this UAF but..<!----></span><br><br>I wonder if ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() could just post a task to delete the scoped_ref<ContextProviderCommandBuffer> it holds to ensure it's impossible to destroy the ContextProviderCommandBuffer object in the same call stack as the context loss event?<span class="line"><!---->I wonder if ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() could just post a task to delete the scoped_ref&lt;ContextProviderCommandBuffer&gt; it holds to ensure it's impossible to destroy the ContextProviderCommandBuffer object in the same call stack as the context loss event?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            <div class="container-issue-content">
              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/95.0.4628.3 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/95.0.4628.3 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>#TestOn<span class="line"><!---->#TestOn<!----></span><br>Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64<span class="line"><!---->Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64<!----></span><br>git status<span class="line"><!---->git status<!----></span><br>HEAD detached from 77ffd97a139<span class="line"><!---->HEAD detached from 77ffd97a139<!----></span><br><br>#Reproduce<span class="line"><!---->#Reproduce<!----></span><br>This issue is not stable to reproduce, but it is easy to find through a code audit, so I did not provide a POC but provided an analysis<span class="line"><!---->This issue is not stable to reproduce, but it is easy to find through a code audit, so I did not provide a POC but provided an analysis<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash<!----></span><br>gpu process<span class="line"><!---->gpu process<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 95.0.4628.3  Channel: n/a<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 95.0.4628.3  Channel: n/a<!----></span><br>OS Version: 10.0<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: 10.0<!----></span><br><br>#Analysis<span class="line"><!---->#Analysis<!----></span><br>CommandBufferProxyImpl is member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj,This issue occurs in a special situation, when CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect is called, it will cause ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj to be released, resulting in UAF.<span class="line"><!---->CommandBufferProxyImpl is member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj,This issue occurs in a special situation, when CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect is called, it will cause ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj to be released, resulting in UAF.<!----></span><br><br>1. CommandBufferProxyImpl obj created when ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread() call and save as a unique_ptr member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer<span class="line"><!---->1. CommandBufferProxyImpl obj created when ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread() call and save as a unique_ptr member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer<!----></span><br>2. CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize was call form ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread(),in CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize it will set CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect as set_disconnect_handler callback<span class="line"><!---->2. CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize was call form ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread(),in CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize it will set CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect as set_disconnect_handler callback<!----></span><br>3. When set_disconnect_handler called OnDisconnect call OnGpuAsyncMessageError,which Will eventually call ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() because[4]<span class="line"><!---->3. When set_disconnect_handler called OnDisconnect call OnGpuAsyncMessageError,which Will eventually call ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() because[4]<!----></span><br>4. ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() will take ref of this[5],and relese this out of scope.<span class="line"><!---->4. ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() will take ref of this[5],and relese this out of scope.<!----></span><br>5. Then the function returns to CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect and operates on lock_&last_state_lock_, because ContextProviderCommandBuffer released cause CommandBufferProxyImpl released too, resulting in UAF. <span class="line"><!---->5. Then the function returns to CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect and operates on lock_&amp;last_state_lock_, because ContextProviderCommandBuffer released cause CommandBufferProxyImpl released too, resulting in UAF. <!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>//<span class="line"><!---->//<!----></span><br>services/viz/public/cpp/gpu/context_provider_command_buffer.cc：141<span class="line"><!---->services/viz/public/cpp/gpu/context_provider_command_buffer.cc：141<!----></span><br>gpu::ContextResult ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread() {<span class="line"><!---->gpu::ContextResult ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread() {<!----></span><br>  // This is called on the thread the context will be used.<span class="line"><!---->  // This is called on the thread the context will be used.<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(context_thread_checker_.CalledOnValidThread());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(context_thread_checker_.CalledOnValidThread());<!----></span><br><br><<<-CUT->>><span class="line"><!---->&lt;&lt;&lt;-CUT-&gt;&gt;&gt;<!----></span><br>  // This command buffer is a client-side proxy to the command buffer in the<span class="line"><!---->  // This command buffer is a client-side proxy to the command buffer in the<!----></span><br>  // GPU process.<span class="line"><!---->  // GPU process.<!----></span><br>  command_buffer_ = std::make_unique<gpu::CommandBufferProxyImpl>(			<<[1]<span class="line"><!---->  command_buffer_ = std::make_unique&lt;gpu::CommandBufferProxyImpl&gt;(			&lt;&lt;[1]<!----></span><br>      channel_, gpu_memory_buffer_manager_, stream_id_, task_runner);<span class="line"><!---->      channel_, gpu_memory_buffer_manager_, stream_id_, task_runner);<!----></span><br>  bind_result_ = command_buffer_->Initialize(<span class="line"><!---->  bind_result_ = command_buffer_-&gt;Initialize(<!----></span><br>      surface_handle_, /*shared_command_buffer=*/nullptr, stream_priority_,<span class="line"><!---->      surface_handle_, /*shared_command_buffer=*/nullptr, stream_priority_,<!----></span><br>      attributes_, active_url_);<span class="line"><!---->      attributes_, active_url_);<!----></span><br><br>//<span class="line"><!---->//<!----></span><br>gpu/ipc/client/command_buffer_proxy_impl.cc:136  <span class="line"><!---->gpu/ipc/client/command_buffer_proxy_impl.cc:136  <!----></span><br>ContextResult CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize(<span class="line"><!---->ContextResult CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize(<!----></span><br>    gpu::SurfaceHandle surface_handle,<span class="line"><!----> gpu::SchedulingPriority stream_priority,<span class="line"><!---->    gpu::SchedulingPriority stream_priority,<!----></span><br>    const gpu::ContextCreationAttribs& attribs,<span class="line"><!---->    const gpu::ContextCreationAttribs&amp; attribs,<!----></span><br>    const GURL& active_url) {<span class="line"><!---->    const GURL&amp; active_url) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(!share_group || (stream_id_ == share_group->stream_id_));<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(!share_group || (stream_id_ == share_group-&gt;stream_id_));<!----></span><br>  TRACE_EVENT0("gpu", "GpuChannelHost::CreateViewCommandBuffer");<span class="line"><!---->  TRACE_EVENT0("gpu", "GpuChannelHost::CreateViewCommandBuffer");<!----></span><br><br><<<-CUT->>><span class="line"><!---->&lt;&lt;&lt;-CUT-&gt;&gt;&gt;<!----></span><br><br>  client_receiver_.set_disconnect_handler(base::BindOnce(<span class="line"><!---->  client_receiver_.set_disconnect_handler(base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>      &CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect, base::Unretained(this)));		<<[2]<span class="line"><!---->      &amp;CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect, base::Unretained(this)));		&lt;&lt;[2]<!----></span><br><br>  channel_ = std::move(channel);<span class="line"><!---->  channel_ = std::move(channel);<!----></span><br>  return result;<span class="line"><!---->  return result;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>//<span class="line"><!---->//<!----></span><br>gpu/ipc/client/command_buffer_proxy_impl.cc:156<span class="line"><!---->gpu/ipc/client/command_buffer_proxy_impl.cc:156<!----></span><br>void CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect() {<span class="line"><!---->void CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect() {<!----></span><br>  base::AutoLockMaybe lock(lock_);<span class="line"><!---->  base::AutoLockMaybe lock(lock_);<!----></span><br>  base::AutoLock last_state_lock(last_state_lock_);<span class="line"><!---->  base::AutoLock last_state_lock(last_state_lock_);<!----></span><br><br>  gpu::error::ContextLostReason context_lost_reason =<span class="line"><!---->  gpu::error::ContextLostReason context_lost_reason =<!----></span><br>      gpu::error::kGpuChannelLost;<span class="line"><!---->      gpu::error::kGpuChannelLost;<!----></span><br>  if (shared_state_mapping_.IsValid()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (shared_state_mapping_.IsValid()) {<!----></span><br>    // The GPU process might have intentionally been crashed<span class="line"><!---->    // The GPU process might have intentionally been crashed<!----></span><br>    // (exit_on_context_lost), so try to find out the original reason.<span class="line"><!---->    // (exit_on_context_lost), so try to find out the original reason.<!----></span><br>    TryUpdateStateDontReportError();<span         by

          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          sunn...@chromium.org kylec...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          sunn...@chromium.org kylec...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Looks valid, and also looks like this bug may have existed for quite a while.<span class="line"><!---->Looks valid, and also looks like this bug may have existed for quite a while.<!----></span><br><br>AFAICT ContextProviderCommandBuffer has ~always synchronously invoked OnContextLost on its observers in response to context loss, and CommandBufferProxyImpl has never been safe to delete within GpuControlClient::OnGpuControlLostContext due to CBPI's lock management around that invocation.<span class="line"><!---->AFAICT ContextProviderCommandBuffer has ~always synchronously invoked OnContextLost on its observers in response to context loss, and CommandBufferProxyImpl has never been safe to delete within GpuControlClient::OnGpuControlLostContext due to CBPI's lock management around that invocation.<!----></span><br><br>So as long as it's been possible for an observer's OnContextLost to result in CPCB deletion, this bug has been possible. I see a local stack ref was added some time later to prevent the CPCB from being destroyed within OnLostContext itself, but of course it (and its CBPI) can still then be destroyed upon OnLostContext return in that case.<span class="line"><!---->So as long as it's been possible for an observer's OnContextLost to result in CPCB deletion, this bug has been possible. I see a local stack ref was added some time later to prevent the CPCB from being destroyed within OnLostContext itself, but of course it (and its CBPI) can still then be destroyed upon OnLostContext return in that case.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        ContextProviderCommandBuffer owns a pretty complicated hierarchy of classes and context loss handling code is messy. I'm sure the context loss code could be reworked to be a bit more straight forward and hopefully avoid this UAF but..<span class="line"><!---->ContextProviderCommandBuffer owns a pretty complicated hierarchy of classes and context loss handling code is messy. I'm sure the context loss code could be reworked to be a bit more straight forward and hopefully avoid this UAF but..<!----></span><br><br>I wonder if ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() could just post a task to delete the scoped_ref<ContextProviderCommandBuffer> it holds to ensure it's impossible to destroy the ContextProviderCommandBuffer object in the same call stack as the context loss event?<span class="line"><!---->I wonder if ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() could just post a task to delete the scoped_ref&lt;ContextProviderCommandBuffer&gt; it holds to ensure it's impossible to destroy the ContextProviderCommandBuffer object in the same call stack as the context loss event?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/95.0.4628.3 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/95.0.4628.3 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>#TestOn<span class="line"><!---->#TestOn<!----></span><br>Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64<span class="line"><!---->Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64<!----></span><br>git status<span class="line"><!---->git status<!----></span><br>HEAD detached from 77ffd97a139<span class="line"><!---->HEAD detached from 77ffd97a139<!----></span><br><br>#Reproduce<span class="line"><!---->#Reproduce<!----></span><br>This issue is not stable to reproduce, but it is easy to find through a code audit, so I did not provide a POC but provided an analysis<span class="line"><!---->This issue is not stable to reproduce, but it is easy to find through a code audit, so I did not provide a POC but provided an analysis<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash<!----></span><br>gpu process<span class="line"><!---->gpu process<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 95.0.4628.3  Channel: n/a<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 95.0.4628.3  Channel: n/a<!----></span><br>OS Version: 10.0<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: 10.0<!----></span><br><br>#Analysis<span class="line"><!---->#Analysis<!----></span><br>CommandBufferProxyImpl is member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj,This issue occurs in a special situation, when CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect is called, it will cause ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj to be released, resulting in UAF.<span class="line"><!---->CommandBufferProxyImpl is member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj,This issue occurs in a special situation, when CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect is called, it will cause ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj to be released, resulting in UAF.<!----></span><br><br>1. CommandBufferProxyImpl obj created when ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread() call and save as a unique_ptr member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer<span class="line"><!---->1. CommandBufferProxyImpl obj created when ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread() call and save as a unique_ptr member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer<!----></span><br>2. CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize was call form ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread(),in CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize it will set CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect as set_disconnect_handler callback<span class="line"><!---->2. CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize was call form ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread(),in CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize it will set CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect as set_disconnect_handler callback<!----></span><br>3. When set_disconnect_handler called OnDisconnect call OnGpuAsyncMessageError,which Will eventually call ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() because[4]<span class="line"><!---->3. When set_disconnect_handler called OnDisconnect call OnGpuAsyncMessageError,which Will eventually call ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() because[4]<!----></span><br>4. ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() will take ref of this[5],and relese this out of scope.<span class="line"><!---->4. ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() will take ref of this[5],and relese this out of scope.<!----></span><br>5. Then the function returns to CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect and operates on lock_&last_state_lock_, because ContextProviderCommandBuffer released cause CommandBufferProxyImpl released too, resulting in UAF. <span class="line"><!---->5. Then the function returns to CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect and operates on lock_&amp;last_state_lock_, because ContextProviderCommandBuffer released cause CommandBufferProxyImpl released too, resulting in UAF. <!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>//<span         by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1250655#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Sep 17, 2021, 6:49 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          sunn...@chromium.org kylec...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          sunn...@chromium.org kylec...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Looks valid, and also looks like this bug may have existed for quite a while.<span class="line"><!---->Looks valid, and also looks like this bug may have existed for quite a while.<!----></span><br><br>AFAICT ContextProviderCommandBuffer has ~always synchronously invoked OnContextLost on its observers in response to context loss, and CommandBufferProxyImpl has never been safe to delete within GpuControlClient::OnGpuControlLostContext due to CBPI's lock management around that invocation.<span class="line"><!---->AFAICT ContextProviderCommandBuffer has ~always synchronously invoked OnContextLost on its observers in response to context loss, and CommandBufferProxyImpl has never been safe to delete within GpuControlClient::OnGpuControlLostContext due to CBPI's lock management around that invocation.<!----></span><br><br>So as long as it's been possible for an observer's OnContextLost to result in CPCB deletion, this bug has been possible. I see a local stack ref was added some time later to prevent the CPCB from being destroyed within OnLostContext itself, but of course it (and its CBPI) can still then be destroyed upon OnLostContext return in that case.<span class="line"><!---->So as long as it's been possible for an observer's OnContextLost to result in CPCB deletion, this bug has been possible. I see a local stack ref was added some time later to prevent the CPCB from being destroyed within OnLostContext itself, but of course it (and its CBPI) can still then be destroyed upon OnLostContext return in that case.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          Comment 8<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1250655#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      kylec...@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2612733449" title="kylec...@chromium.org"><!---->kylec...@chromium.org<!----></a>
      kylec...@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->kylec...@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Sep 20, 2021, 9:56 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1250655#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Sep 20, 2021, 9:56 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1250655#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Sep 20, 2021, 9:56 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        ContextProviderCommandBuffer owns a pretty complicated hierarchy of classes and context loss handling code is messy. I'm sure the context loss code could be reworked to be a bit more straight forward and hopefully avoid this UAF but..<span class="line"><!---->ContextProviderCommandBuffer owns a pretty complicated hierarchy of classes and context loss handling code is messy. I'm sure the context loss code could be reworked to be a bit more straight forward and hopefully avoid this UAF but..<!----></span><br><br>I wonder if ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() could just post a task to delete the scoped_ref<ContextProviderCommandBuffer> it holds to ensure it's impossible to destroy the ContextProviderCommandBuffer object in the same call stack as the context loss event?<span class="line"><!---->I wonder if ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() could just post a task to delete the scoped_ref&lt;ContextProviderCommandBuffer&gt; it holds to ensure it's impossible to destroy the ContextProviderCommandBuffer object in the same call stack as the context loss event?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/95.0.4628.3 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/95.0.4628.3 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>#TestOn<span class="line"><!---->#TestOn<!----></span><br>Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64<span class="line"><!---->Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64<!----></span><br>git status<span class="line"><!---->git status<!----></span><br>HEAD detached from 77ffd97a139<span class="line"><!---->HEAD detached from 77ffd97a139<!----></span><br><br>#Reproduce<span class="line"><!---->#Reproduce<!----></span><br>This issue is not stable to reproduce, but it is easy to find through a code audit, so I did not provide a POC but provided an analysis<span class="line"><!---->This issue is not stable to reproduce, but it is easy to find through a code audit, so I did not provide a POC but provided an analysis<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash<!----></span><br>gpu process<span class="line"><!---->gpu process<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 95.0.4628.3  Channel: n/a<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 95.0.4628.3  Channel: n/a<!----></span><br>OS Version: 10.0<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: 10.0<!----></span><br><br>#Analysis<span class="line"><!---->#Analysis<!----></span><br>CommandBufferProxyImpl is member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj,This issue occurs in a special situation, when CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect is called, it will cause ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj to be released, resulting in UAF.<span class="line"><!---->CommandBufferProxyImpl is member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj,This issue occurs in a special situation, when CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect is called, it will cause ContextProviderCommandBuffer obj to be released, resulting in UAF.<!----></span><br><br>1. CommandBufferProxyImpl obj created when ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread() call and save as a unique_ptr member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer<span class="line"><!---->1. CommandBufferProxyImpl obj created when ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread() call and save as a unique_ptr member of ContextProviderCommandBuffer<!----></span><br>2. CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize was call form ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread(),in CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize it will set CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect as set_disconnect_handler callback<span class="line"><!---->2. CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize was call form ContextProviderCommandBuffer::BindToCurrentThread(),in CommandBufferProxyImpl::Initialize it will set CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect as set_disconnect_handler callback<!----></span><br>3. When set_disconnect_handler called OnDisconnect call OnGpuAsyncMessageError,which Will eventually call ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() because[4]<span class="line"><!---->3. When set_disconnect_handler called OnDisconnect call OnGpuAsyncMessageError,which Will eventually call ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() because[4]<!----></span><br>4. ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() will take ref of this[5],and relese this out of scope.<span class="line"><!---->4. ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() will take ref of this[5],and relese this out of scope.<!----></span><br>5. Then the function returns to CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect and operates on lock_&last_state_lock_, because ContextProviderCommandBuffer released cause CommandBufferProxyImpl released too, resulting in UAF. <span class="line"><!---->5. Then the function returns to CommandBufferProxyImpl::OnDisconnect and operates on lock_&amp;last_state_lock_, because ContextProviderCommandBuffer released cause CommandBufferProxyImpl released too, resulting in UAF. <!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>//<span class="line"><!---->//<!----></span><br>services/viz/public/cpp/gpu/context_provider_command_buffer.cc：141<span         by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1250655#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Sep 17, 2021, 6:49 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1250655#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Sep 17, 2021, 6:49 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          sunn...@chromium.org kylec...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          sunn...@chromium.org kylec...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Looks valid, and also looks like this bug may have existed for quite a while.<span class="line"><!---->Looks valid, and also looks like this bug may have existed for quite a while.<!----></span><br><br>AFAICT ContextProviderCommandBuffer has ~always synchronously invoked OnContextLost on its observers in response to context loss, and CommandBufferProxyImpl has never been safe to delete within GpuControlClient::OnGpuControlLostContext due to CBPI's lock management around that invocation.<span class="line"><!---->AFAICT ContextProviderCommandBuffer has ~always synchronously invoked OnContextLost on its observers in response to context loss, and CommandBufferProxyImpl has never been safe to delete within GpuControlClient::OnGpuControlLostContext due to CBPI's lock management around that invocation.<!----></span><br><br>So as long as it's been possible for an observer's OnContextLost to result in CPCB deletion, this bug has been possible. I see a local stack ref was added some time later to prevent the CPCB from being destroyed within OnLostContext itself, but of course it (and its CBPI) can still then be destroyed upon OnLostContext return in that case.<span class="line"><!---->So as long as it's been possible for an observer's OnContextLost to result in CPCB deletion, this bug has been possible. I see a local stack ref was added some time later to prevent the CPCB from being destroyed within OnLostContext itself, but of course it (and its CBPI) can still then be destroyed upon OnLostContext return in that case.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority.         ContextProviderCommandBuffer owns a pretty complicated hierarchy of classes and context loss handling code is messy. I'm sure the context loss code could be reworked to be a bit more straight forward and hopefully avoid this UAF but..<span class="line"><!---->ContextProviderCommandBuffer owns a pretty complicated hierarchy of classes and context loss handling code is messy. I'm sure the context loss code could be reworked to be a bit more straight forward and hopefully avoid this UAF but..<!----></span><br><br>I wonder if ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() could just post a task to delete the scoped_ref<ContextProviderCommandBuffer> it holds to ensure it's impossible to destroy the ContextProviderCommandBuffer object in the same call stack as the context loss event?<span class="line"><!---->I wonder if ContextProviderCommandBuffer::OnLostContext() could just post a task to delete the scoped_ref&lt;ContextProviderCommandBuffer&gt; it holds to ensure it's impossible to destroy the ContextProviderCommandBuffer object in the same call stack as the context loss event?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
